job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Sarasota, FL
pros: Ive worked as a tech for 30 years ,
cons: Injured now,just tired and need an Easier position

review_title: A Good Foot In The Door
pros: Very nice staff and a wonderful place to develop skills in your career.
cons: Rate of pay is low compared to competitors.

review_title: Short Staffed, so you do other roles tasks, as well as your own.
job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Sarasota, FL
pros:
Frequent employee appreciation events, mostly free food.
Tuition reimbursement and partnership with Galen College of Nursing.
Doctors of Sarasota is a small hospital, so you get to know almost everyone in so many departments over time. The healthcare plans offered aren't bad and the local network is not small, as we overlap with Intercoastal Medical Group.
I feel like *most* of my coworkers care a lot and are patient-driven.
Vacation days accumulate in some kinda hidden measured fashion, but I earned two weeks off by my 6-month mark.
cons:
THE PAY S TOO LOW TO LIVE HERE! ( have a 2nd job and I'm FT at DHOS)

As a PCT, you will have a large assignment due to short staffing, or when it's a better day, "de-staffing"...so your assignment will surely change midday.
We are short-staffed in roles that support PCT/the floors, like housekeeping, dietary, and supply/stocking. So you have to cover for those missed tasks, like empty trashcans, chase down missing meal trays, and run to other units to gather supplies, like whips, chuck pads, etc.
Even as FT "core" you have little control over your schedule, but unit managers and charges often help move things around and you can swap days with a co-worker.
There are a ton of traveler/agency staff RNs and PTCs these days in COVID, 
But they are usually some of the strangest and most skilled staff because most of my "core" or fellow FT on my unit are very recent new grads. It's hard to learn when no one has any experience or time. The lack of resources and "go-to" staff is stressful and makes for poor customer service interactions too often.
There's endless talk about "customer service" from leadership, but the staffing ratios are kept lean, highlighting the profit-driven bottom line.
Overall, the short staffing and lack of wage increases through and during a pandemic cloud everything with burnout, bitterness, and exhaustion.

pros: Great coworkers, pleasant environment, clean hospital
cons: Terrible pay, company doesn’t support you, short staffed

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Sarasota, FL
pros: The unit I worked on was during night shift, which have some amazing nurses and some great CNA’s. Most of them are team players.
cons: Terrible food, pay is very low, raises are horrible, union is terrible, place is falling apart in the ceilings and they do patch work and not fix the issues. Some nurses get away with a lot when they should’ve been fired a long time ago.

review_title: Good Benefits Overall, Need to Value Hard Work
pros: Good colleagues and size of unit is manageable.
cons: Underpaid for Education, Degrees and Licensure; No holidays

review_title: Awful place for nurses to work.
pros: 3 day work week which is the standard for RNs.
cons:
Disorganized . Cheap and antiquated equipment . A general lack of supplies. Poor compliance with infectious disease prevention standards. Poor support of nursing staff. Generally two PCTs on floor for 40 patients .  Poor moral among employees and a high turn over rate. Appears to be driven by a culture of fear and punishment from the Chief of nursing all the way down. 
Terrible pay with pitiful or no raises.  Chief of nurses compared nurses to waitresses during general orientation :(
Oh there is so much more but why go on...
If you don't work here yet then run away. If you do then chances are you are hanging on until retirement within 2 yrs tops or you are talking about and planning to leave.

I quickly decided this place was not worth risking my license or health.

pros: great teamwork, free parking, free food when working holidays
cons: understaffed, focus on patient wants instead of patient health needs, money put into renovating hospital floors instead of adequate pay

pros: Very good employer. Honest and reliable managers. Great benefits and room to grow. Exercise equipment on site for employees to use.
cons: Have to work overnights, weekends, and, holidays.
